Allocate a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> with the operands co-allocated.

If DescBytes is non-zero then allocate an additional DescBytes bytes before the operands. These bytes can be accessed by calling getDescriptor.

## Public Member Functions

### dropAllReferences() {#a48ec5fcee6d2c17c723e8e67f169f948}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype="void llvm::User::dropAllReferences ()"
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Drop all references to operands.

This function is in charge of &quot;letting go&quot; of all objects that this <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/user">User</a> refers to. This allows one to &#39;delete&#39; a whole class at a time, even though there may be circular references... First all references are dropped, and all use counts go to zero. Then everything is deleted for real. Note that no operations are valid on an object that has &quot;dropped
all references&quot;, except operator delete.

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/user-h/#l00345">345</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/ir/user-h">User.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
